content: Seeking Earth-like planets NASA launching $600 million telescope to solve space mystery — Some astronomers believe the mission, set to start this week, could find about 50 planets comparable to our own. By detecting tiny changes in brightness, telescope will seek planets comparable to our own The universe may be filled with Earth-like planets — worlds where extraterrestrials might flourish. But these planets were once considered too small to spot, even with the latest in space technology. Now, many astronomers believe NASA’s $600 million Kepler telescope, which is scheduled to shoot into space this week, will help to clear up the mystery. Named for Johannes Kepler, a 17th-century German astronomer who studied planetary motion, the telescope is designed to search 100,000 stars in the Milky Way for Earth-sized rocky planets where water could flow and form streams, lakes and oceans. Some astronomers believe the spacecraft could eventually find about 50 Earth-like planets. Full story at ... >http://www.chron.com/disp/story.mpl/nation/6288788.html
